MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: Which book introduced a theoretical neural structure by Donald Hebb in 1949?
Choices: a: The Organization of Behavior | b: Computing Machinery and Intelligence | c: Learning Machines | d: The Organization of Artificial Neurons

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cybernetics | b: Cybertron | c: RoboBrain | d: NeuroBot

MCQ: Who provided a formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Alan Turing | d: Arthur Samuel

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To confuse data and make random predictions | b: To classify data and make predictions for future outcomes | c: To play chess and solve puzzles | d: To write code and design websites
